ai.summary: Hermaness is a 15.6 km hard coastal hike in the UK, known for dramatic sea cliffs, open skies, and potential seabird sightings. The route is exposed and rugged, demanding good fitness and careful planning for a full-day outing.
ai.terrain_summary: Coastal path along sea cliffs with heather moorland and uneven rocky sections. Expect exposed winds, long open stretches with cliffs nearby, and occasional boggy ground.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for a remote coastal walk with rapidly changing weather. Wear sturdy boots and waterproof clothing; steer clear of cliff edges and loose ground. Navigation is important in mist—carry a map, compass or GPS. Bring enough water and high-energy snacks for a full day, plus a basic first aid kit and an emergency whistle. Check daylight hours and local conditions; mobile reception can be limited in remote areas.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Map and compass or GPS device
Small first aid kit and emergency whistle
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly May–September) offers milder weather and better visibility, though wind and rain can occur any time in the UK.

seo.title: Hermaness Coastal Hike – 15.6 km Hard Route in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover Hermaness: a 15.6 km hard coastal hike in the UK featuring dramatic sea cliffs, rugged terrain, and wildlife. Safety tips, gear recommendations, and the best season to hike.
